column4: My laptop has a HDD with two NTFS partitions, one 14GB, one 40GB for storage. I want to turn this XP machine into a dualboot w/ Ubuntu. Would it be safe to just back up the first (14GB partition), wipe it, and do the dual boot install, and not worry about backing up the data partition?
probably but there's no guarantee.  Especially if you're inexperienced.
I've been using an ext3fs driver in windows xp very succesfully.
that's a common way to do things.
